text: English vocabulary lesson 18 topic
expressions with the word table do you
buy everything new or do you sometimes
buy use things I think you know my
answer to that question not too long ago
I bought a used accordion well two days
ago I bought another used item I found a
man in a neighboring town who advertised
on the Internet his old kitchen table
and chairs so his old table and chairs
became my new table and chairs and to
celebrate my new kitchen set I'm going
to teach you three expressions that use
the word table
let's begin watch listen define
[Music]
you will watch it listen to a
conversation between Jennifer that's me
and Sally a nurse and health care
coordinator in the United States each
clip will introduce you to a new
expression with the word table you must
try to understand the meaning of the
expression based on the conversation you
hear so Sally thanks for doing this oh
you're welcome thanks for sitting at
menu table I love your new table so do i
well if it's okay I'd like to talk to
you about work and jobs sure okay sure
[Music]
expression number one pay someone under
the table what kinds of jobs involve
getting paid under the table well
getting paid under the table would be
jobs like mowing the lawn babysitting
sometimes it could be construction work
you know something in your house don't
you think there are some dangers when
you get paid under the table salutely if
you're injured when you're paid under
the table there's no recourse there's no
insurance to pay for your injury there's
no build up of Social Security so you
missed that income
can you think of any reasons why
somebody would choose to be paid under
the table well a teenager would choose
to be paid under the table because
they're not working consistently enough
to be kept on the books so to speak so
some of you babysat a couple of times a
week or mowed your lawn every once in a
while that kind of thing that would be
more beneficial for both to be paid
under the table or it could be somebody
who didn't want to pay taxes too
you heard the expression paste someone
under the table what does this
expression mean a pay someone secretly
be refused to pay someone see pay
someone to little money the answer is a
to pay someone under the table is to pay
the person secretly or unofficially
sometimes people get paid under the
table because the work is illegal
[Music]
expression number two lay your cards on
the table do you think at a job
interview one should lay all his or her
cards on the table that's an interesting
question I don't I think you should
answer every question truthfully but I
don't necessarily think you need to lay
all your cards on the table
I'm not sure you should tell them what
salary you'd be willing to settle for
for example I don't think you should
tell them that in the back of your mind
you love to be able to move to a warmer
climate or be closer to your
grandchildren so I don't think they did
a job interview they're entitled to know
everything okay
you heard the expression lay your cards
on the table what does this expression
mean a lie about your experience or
skills B be truthful about your plans C
ask an employer for more money the
answer be
to lay all your cards on the table is to
tell all of your thoughts all of your
plans the idea is to be completely
truthful about your intentions or your
position the expression lay all your
cards on the table comes from card
playing when you play a game of cards
you don't show your hand to the other
players part of playing the game is
keeping the secret about whether you
have strong cards or weak cards of
course at the end cards are laid on the
table and then everything is revealed
and naturally if you believe you have
the winning hand you'll be excited to
lay your cards on the table expression
number three bring something to the
table
at a job interrview how can one
demonstrate what they bring to the table
in my job I work as a nurse but I lately
been asked to take on more and more
responsibilities something I think is
common today so I'm learning to do more
case management skills I'm learning to
do a little bit of marketing I'm
learning all of those skills so if I
were looking for a good job I make sure
I mentioned those things that would make
me stand out as a candidate that would
be different from another nurse looking
for that position
you heard the expression bring something
to the table what does this expression
mean a earned good money B add value to
the group C create a problem for the
group the answer B
to bring something to the table is to
contribute to the group it's to provide
something special that everyone can
benefit from I think it's easy to
understand where this expression came
from just think of a family or a group
of friends around a table if one person
brings something to that table its food
for everyone to eat it's something
everyone can share let's review our
three expressions what's the expression
to pay someone secretly or unofficially
usually because it's illegal
do you remember pays someone under the
table look at three common ways we use
this expression pay someone under the
table be paid under the table get paid
under the table what's the expression to
be completely truthful about your plans
thoughts or position
do you remember lay your cards on the
table note you can use the verb lay or
put and we often use the word all to
emphasize that complete truthfulness lay
all your cards on the table put all your
cards on the table what's the expression
to add value to the group to contribute
something that benefits the group
especially in a work setting
do you remember bring something to the
table it's common to hear this
expression in the form of a question for
example what do you bring to the table
what does he bring to the table and if
you want to emphasize that a person can
contribute something significant we can
say that he or she brings a lot to the
table so if you want to sound confident
in a job interview you can say I believe
I bring a lot to the table
exercise 1 complete each statement with
one of the new expressions 1 read the
statement to yourself and then I'll tell
you the answer answer an employer always
hires a candidate who can bring
something to the table more clients new
ideas a high level of skills etc 2
answer many American families pay
babysitter's under the table not because
it's a secret but because the amount of
money is usually small and it's
convenient free
answer people don't always lay their
cards on the table and business deals
they only share as much information as
they have to exercise and to answer the
questions if you have a study partner
you can use these questions for
conversation practice take turns asking
and answering if you're studying by
yourself write down your answers or
consider recording them play your
answers back and see if you can correct
your pronunciation and use of grammar
one is getting paid under the table a
dishonest practice why or why not
- in a situation where there's one job
and two candidates
what should a company do be loyal to a
dedicated but average worker or hire a
new person who brings more to the table
three recall the time when you put all
your cards on the table did being
completely truthful help the situation
[Music]
additional practice for this lesson is
available at English cafe comm my user
name is Jennifer ESL use the direct link
listed in the video description
[Music]
that's all for now thanks for watching
and happy studies
